com.versant.odmg
Class Database

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.odmg.Database

public class Database
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the ODMG 2.0 compliant Database class. The predefined type Database represents a database. You must open a Database instance before starting any transactions that use the database, and close it after ending the transactions.

A Database object, like a Transaction object is transient. You must open a Database instance before starting any transactions that use the database, and close it after ending the transactions.

To open a database, call the static open() method, which takes the name of the database as its argument. This call locates the named database and makes the appropriate connection to it. You must open a database before you can access objects in that database.

See Also:
Transaction

Constructor Detail

Database

public Database()
Constructs a new database object. This method initializes the access mode to Database.notOpen.

Method Detail

open

public static Database open(java.lang.String name,
                            int aMode)
                     throws ODMGException
Opens a database.

Parameters:
name - The name of the database being opened.
aMode - The access mode with which to open the database. Valid values are:
  • Database.openReadOnly
  • Database.openReadWrite
  • Database.openExclusive

    • This method locates the named database and makes a connection to it. A database must be opened before accessing any objects in it.

Throws:
An - IllegalArgumentException if the name is invalid access mode is not recognized, or if the notOpen access mode is provided.
ODMGException

close

public void close()
           throws ODMGException
Cleans up a database connection.

This method cleans up the named database connection. After closing a database, subsequent attempts to access objects in the database would lead to the DatabaseClosedException being thrown.

Throws:
DatabaseClosedException - if the database has already been closed.
TransactionInProgressException - if the database still has active transactions associated with it.
ODMGException

bind

public void bind(java.lang.Object obj,
                 java.lang.String name)
Binds an object to a name and makes the object persistent if it is transient.

Parameters:
obj - The object being bound to a name in the database.
name - The name used to bind an object to in the database.

The same object could be bound to more than one name in the database. Names provide one way to navigate and retrieve objects from a database.

Throws:
DatabaseClosedRuntimeException - if the database has already been closed.
IllegalArgumentException - if the database name is invalid.
ObjectNameNotUniqueRuntimeException - if there is an object already bound to this name in the database.
TransactionNotInProgressException - if there is no transaction associated with this database.
See Also:
Database.lookup(String)

lookup

public java.lang.Object lookup(java.lang.String name)
                        throws ObjectNameNotFoundException
Returns a persistent object stored in the database with the given name or returns null if the specified name is bound to null.

Parameters:
name - The object to lookup.

Names provide one way to navigate and retrieve objects from a database.

Throws:
DatabaseClosedRuntimeException - if the database has already been closed.

ObjectNameNotFoundException - if an object with the given name is not found in the database.

IllegalArgumentException - if the name is invalid.

TransactionNotInProgressException - if there is no transaction associated with the database.

ObjectNameNotFoundException

unbind

public void unbind(java.lang.String name)
            throws ObjectNameNotFoundException
Disassociates a previously bound name to a persistent object.

Parameters:
name - The name of the database being opened. Names provide one way to navigate and retrieve objects from a database.
Throws:
DatabaseClosedRuntimeException - if the database has already been closed.
ObjectNameNotFoundException - if the named database does not exist.
ObjectNameNotFoundException
